divs: sighting detailsviewed se of oswestry, this "dot" moved faster than what i have observed a "shooting star" would. it would cross a large distance then stop dead still for a second and performed various random upward\downward, and spiralling motions, disappearing momentarily on occassions, as if blotted by the light cirrus clouds. it performed many of these random movements over the same area for a period of 15 min's until i lost sight of it, at about 23.15hrs. it was a hazy pink colour, which appeared undiminished, and constant in all aspects of size and colour at whatever altitude or plane i saw it. there were aeroplanes visible at the same time, but they were distinguisable by their flashing lights. it made no noise. my initial thoughts were that it was a laser, but these were dispelled when the object could clearly be seen in "open", clear sky.
Object Flight Path: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
trends: There has been one other sighting in Oswestry
There were no other sightings in Oswestry on or around June 10th 2008
